intro: Chassalia obscurinervia, commonly known as the dark-veined chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with distinctive dark veins that give it its common name. The flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months.
